title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 31 December 2008 - XWiki
content:
xwikibot - (31/12/2008 09:38): XWiki.vieop was modified by XWiki.vieop (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/vieop  
xwikibot - (31/12/2008 10:03): Macros.WarningMacro was modified by xwiki:XWiki.VincentMassol (Added comment) - http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Macros/WarningMacro  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:14): anyone?  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:15): I'm looking for a way to use a groovyclass (from a page) from another groovy script  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:15): I can instanciante the object, but since there is no import, I can't call methods   
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:18): do I need to write an interface class?  
lucaa - (31/12/2008 11:18): hi asyd  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:19): hello lucaa !  
lucaa - (31/12/2008 11:21): asyd: I'm no groovy-xwiki master, but I found this: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/GroovyClassHelloWorldTutorial (I suppose you went through it). This is what you want to do, right?  
lucaa - (31/12/2008 11:21): it does not work?  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:22): lucaa: well, the problem is I want to use an existing groovyclass from another groovy script, but I can't do the import ...   
lucaa - (31/12/2008 11:25): asyd: and parseGroovyFromString(Page) does not help?  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:26): that allow me to create an object  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:26): but since there is no correspond import, I can't do object.method()  
lucaa - (31/12/2008 11:26): why? do you have an error with that? (because the tuto I pointed actually does this...)  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:27): the tutorial simply demonstrate how to create a single class  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:27): in my case I have :  
lucaa - (31/12/2008 11:27): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/GroovyClassHelloWorldTutorial#HInstantiateanduseyourclassfromgroovy  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:27): Space.Space1 with a groovyclass  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:27): I can use it from velocity using parseGroovyFromPage, it's working good  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:28): but now, I want to use the class in Space1 from another grovy script (and not a velocity page)  
lucaa - (31/12/2008 11:29): and it's not the same thing as the link I just sent?  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:30): nop, because I can do the object = context.parseGroovyFromPage("Space1.Page1")  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:30): but when I call object.runMethod("blah") since there is no important corresponding to the class defined in Space1.Page1   
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:30): I have some exceptions  
lucaa - (31/12/2008 11:31): mmmh... the tutorial says it should work   
lucaa - (31/12/2008 11:32): what platform version are you using?  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:32): I think you don't understand me  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:32): the tutorial explains how to instance a groovy script from a velocy page  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:33): I want instance a groovy script, from another groovy script  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:33): ah hmm  
lucaa - (31/12/2008 11:33): the tutorial \_also\_ explains how to instantiate a groovy class from groovy  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:33): yeah  I noticed that, sorry, however it doesn't work here :/  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:33): 1.7  
lucaa - (31/12/2008 11:33): ok  
lucaa - (31/12/2008 11:34): can you pastebin your errors?  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:34): (sorry ;p I miss this part ;p)  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:34): yes sure  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:36): http://pastebin.com/m1ad7e7aa this is the Users.SshHelper page  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:37): http://pastebin.com/m1eff4bd7 this is the Main.Notifier page  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:37): (which is used as the notification class)  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:37): and the error  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:38): I have the same error when I remove the import SshHelper; (just was a test)  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:42): hmmthere is no goto line shortcut in xeclipse? :/  
lucaa - (31/12/2008 11:42): asyd: this I really don't know  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:43): ok  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:43): thanks anyway :)  
lucaa - (31/12/2008 11:52): but that tuto does work on your instance, does it? (I'm trying to figure out your code and run it but it's a little complex to "just copy paste and run")  
lucaa - (31/12/2008 11:52): I mean the simple case  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:53): let me try, but I think that work  
asyd - (31/12/2008 11:55): indeed, that works, I guess that doesn't work in my case because I'm inside a class, and not a script?  
lucaa - (31/12/2008 12:07): maybe it also depends how your class is user (Main.Notifier I mean)   
lucaa - (31/12/2008 12:07): could be, but I'm not very knowledgeable about these things... sorry  
xwikibot - (31/12/2008 12:09): XWiki.liqweed was modified by XWiki.liqweed (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/liqweed  
asyd - (31/12/2008 12:38): lucaa: ok  
asyd - (31/12/2008 13:24): hmm  
asyd - (31/12/2008 13:24): groovy.lang.MissingMethodException: No signature of method com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiContext.getXWiki() is applicable fo  
asyd - (31/12/2008 13:24): r argument types: () values: {}  
asyd - (31/12/2008 13:24): however  
asyd - (31/12/2008 13:25): @Programming  
asyd - (31/12/2008 13:25): public com.xpn.xwiki.XWiki getXWiki()  
asyd - (31/12/2008 13:25): in context  
asyd - (31/12/2008 13:25): ah, XWikiContext != Context :/  
xwikibot - (31/12/2008 14:46): Community.DevelopmentPractices was modified by xwiki:XWiki.VincentMassol (Added internal package recommendation) - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentPractices  
xwikibot - (31/12/2008 15:18): Design.RestfulAPI was modified by xwiki:XWiki.fmancinelli - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/RestfulAPI  
xwikibot - (31/12/2008 15:30): XWiki.dmarvasti was modified by XWiki.dmarvasti (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/dmarvasti  
xwikibot - (31/12/2008 22:24): XWiki.emser was modified by XWiki.emser (Created user) - http://workspaces.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/emser
